headline: Is It Too Late To Reassess Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) After A 182% One-Year Surge?
summary: If you are wondering whether Warner Bros. Discovery shares still offer value after their recent run, you are not alone. This article is designed to help you frame that question clearly. The stock last closed at US$27.80, with returns of 2.2% over 7 days, a 3.8% decline over 30 days, a 2.5% decline year to date, a 182.2% return over 1 year, an 88.7% return over 3 years, and a 41.3% decline over 5 years. headline: What Catalysts Are Rewriting The Warner Bros. Discovery WBD Story For Investors
summary: The recent update to Warner Bros. Discovery’s fair value framework centers on a modest move in the price target, with the estimate shifting from US$27.25 to US$28.45 per share. Behind that change, the model now assumes a slightly lower discount rate of 10.24% and refreshed expectations for revenue growth at 22.23%. As you read on, keep an eye on how shifting Street views around corporate actions and industry positioning feed into these inputs, and consider how to track similar narrative...

headline: Ancora to oppose WBD-Netflix deal, Kraft Heinz halts split plans
summary: Morning Brief Host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including the Wall Street Journal reporting that activist investor Ancora is positioned to oppose a potential deal between Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) and Netfix (NFLX), Kraft Heinz (KHC) putting a pause on its plans to spin-off a segment of the food company, and the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) refusing to review Moderna's (MRNA) new flu vaccine. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Ancora Releases Presentation Regarding its Strong Opposition to the Currently Proposed WBD-Netflix Merger
summary: CLEVELAND, February 11, 2026--Ancora Holdings Group, LLC (collectively with its affiliates, "Ancora" or "we"), a nearly $11 billion firm with an approximately $200 million economic interest in Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD"), today released an extensive presentation regarding its strong opposition to the currently proposed merger involving WBD and Netflix, Inc. (NASDAQ: NFLX) ("Netflix"). Ancora's presentation can be downloaded at: www.MaximizeWBDValue.com.

headline: Paramount Skydance Bid Puts Netflix Warner Bros Deal And Valuation In Focus
summary: Paramount Skydance has issued a significantly higher hostile bid to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery, directly challenging Netflix's pending agreement. The offer includes covering multi billion dollar termination and debt refinancing fees, plus extra incentives for Warner Bros. Discovery shareholders. Activist investors are pressing Warner Bros. Discovery to reconsider the Netflix deal, increasing competitive tension and regulatory attention around large streaming mergers. For Netflix...
